title: spec['mpi'].prefix.include doesn't give include dir for intel-mpi
body:
When we install Intel MPI, the prefix looks like:

```

$ ll /gpf....../intel-mpi-2017.3.196-s2b64uud/
total 128
drwxr-xr-x 2 kumbhar-adm bbp 4096 Sep  9 02:53 bin
lrwxrwxrwx 1 kumbhar-adm bbp   28 Sep  9 02:53 compilers_and_libraries -> compilers_and_libraries_2017
drwxr-xr-x 3 kumbhar-adm bbp 4096 Sep  9 02:53 compilers_and_libraries_2017
drwxr-xr-x 4 kumbhar-adm bbp 4096 Sep  9 02:53 compilers_and_libraries_2017.4.196
drwxr-xr-x 4 kumbhar-adm bbp 4096 Sep  9 02:53 documentation_2017
drwxr-xr-x 2 kumbhar-adm bbp 4096 Sep  9 02:53 imb
drwxr-xr-x 2 kumbhar-adm bbp 4096 Sep  9 02:53 impi
-rw-r--r-- 1 kumbhar-adm bbp 5982 Sep  9 02:53 intel_sdp_products.db
lrwxrwxrwx 1 kumbhar-adm bbp   29 Sep  9 02:53 parallel_studio_xe_2017 -> parallel_studio_xe_2017.4.056
drwxr-xr-x 6 kumbhar-adm bbp 4096 Sep  9 02:53 parallel_studio_xe_2017.4.056
drwxr-xr-x 4 kumbhar-adm bbp 4096 Sep  9 02:53 samples_2017
drwxr-xr-x 2 kumbhar-adm bbp 4096 Sep  9 02:53 uninstall
```

So `spec['mpi'].prefix.include` doesn't exist.

P.S. I was using include dir for `tau` package where I explicitly pass `'-mpiinc=%s' % spec['mpi'].prefix.include`
